Inventory Officer Job at Eko Maintenance Limited




        
    

        
        Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in the maintenance of high-rise building facilities with an office located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer                     
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Summary
     

            
    







	Receive and Store Goods: Receive incoming goods, store them appropriately, and ensure they are issued correctly.
	Manage Stock Levels: Monitor and manage stock levels to ensure adequate supplies are available.
	Distribute Supplies: Distribute supplies from stock as needed by different departments.
	Maintain Stock Records: Keep accurate stock records using both manual and computerized systems.
	Coordinate Inventory Functions: Use Excel sheets to coordinate and track inventory functions.
	Track Inventory Movements: Monitor the movement of materials and products in and out of the inventory through accurate record-keeping.
	Store Management: Keep track of goods and supplies within the store, ensuring everything is properly organized and accessible.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Business Administration, Supply chain management or related field.
	2 – 3 years of working experience in a related field.
	Proficiency in inventory software, ERP system, Microsoft Suite ( Excel, word, Outlook)
	Organizational Skills: Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
	Communication Skills: Strong communication skills for effective interaction with team members and other departments.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using "Inventory Officer" as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Fave Consulting
content:
Fave consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Accountant

Job Location: Garki 2, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time (Monday – Saturday: 8am-6pm)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We're looking for a high-performing professional Senior Accountant with strong commercial and financial controls experience in wholesale and retail FMCG, someone who can:
	
		Reconcile complex financial streams (multiple warehouses, terminals, retail outlets)
		Handle stock valuation and periodic stock-takes with precision
		Harmonize bank facilities and credit lines
		Ensure strict compliance with current and new Nigerian tax laws
	
	
	This is NOT a junior cutter-and-payer role — it’s a strategic operational finance position that influences pricing, profitability, and compliance.


Key Roles and Responsibilities


	Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual accounts in line with NRS and Nigerian GAAP.
	Ensure timely bank reconciliations across multiple accounts (operational, POS, supply credits, loans).
	Oversee accounts receivable and payable, enforce strict aging controls, and optimize cash flow.
	Manage fixed assets and depreciation schedules Wholesale & Retail Stock Control
	Lead periodic, full-cycle stocktaking (monthly and quarterly), coordinate teams, and reconcile physical stock with the ERP/Accounting system.
	Administer VAT, Withholding Tax, Companies Income Tax, and other statutory deductions as per the latest Nigerian tax laws.
	Monitor and harmonize bank facilities — overdrafts, POS merchant settlements, trade credits. •
	Forecast financing needs and strategize to minimize borrowing costs. Advise on pricing, promotions, discounts, and margin impact models.
	Partner with Sales, Operations, and Inventory teams to align financial strategy with execution.
	Maintain integrity of accounting system — strict controls, audit trails, authorization workflows.
	Train team members on process compliance and financial discipline.
	Perform ad-hoc analyses as required by the CEO/Director.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Minimum 3 - 5 years of hands-on experience in FMCG wholesale/retail accounting
	Professional qualification (ICAN / ACCA / CPA / ACA)
	Strong understanding of stocktaking processes, inventory valuation, and ERP systems
	Deep knowledge of Nigerian Tax Act, VAT, WHT, CIT, stamp duties and compliance requirements
	Advanced Excel skills; ERP experience (SAP, Oracle, QuickBooks Enterprise, Odoo, etc.)
	Proven ability to reconcile complex bank portfolios and financial streams.
	Experience with multi-location operations
	Exposure to treasury or bank negotiations
	Experience working with external auditors.


Salary
N250,000 – N300,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date:19th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (PDF format) to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Garki 2, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Work schedule: Monday – Saturday 8am-6pm

Job Summary


	We're looking for a high-performing professional Accountant to join our fast-paced FMCG team! To implement, design and manage a robust, end-to-end accounting system that ensures financial accuracy, transparency, and accountability across all business units — including procurement, warehousing, field sales, and e-commerce operations under MyKiaKia.com.
	The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical and process-driven capabilities, with proven experience establishing accounting controls and digital automation in FMCG or e-commerce environments.


Ket Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate books of account, ensuring all transactions (cash, POS, and online) are reconciled daily.
	Prepare and submit weekly cashflow, expense, and profit reports by Monday, 10 a.m.
	Generate monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cashflow).
	Verify the accuracy of sales and inventory records with the warehouse and sales teams.
	Develop, document, and enforce Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for petty cash, supplier payments, staff advances, expense approvals, and bank reconciliations.
	Establish a multi-level approval workflow to prevent unauthorized disbursements.
	Maintain complete documentation for audit readiness and compliance. Conduct variance analyses to detect and address potential fraud, wastage, or cash leakage.
	Implement control mechanisms to safeguard company assets and ensure operational efficiency.
	Ensure all transactions, invoices, and expenses are digitized and properly archived.
	Integrate financial systems with sales and inventory platforms for real-time reconciliation.


Requirements


	B.Sc. or HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field with 2–4 years of experience in FMCG, retail, or e-commerce accounting.
	ICAN or ACCA certification (preferred).
	Proven record in process design, financial automation, and internal controls.
	Hands-on experience with QuickBooks, Zoho Books, or similar ERP platforms.
	Strong analytical, reporting, and reconciliation capabilities.
	High attention to detail and integrity.
	Proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet strict deadlines.
	Financial discipline & ethical standards.
	SOP design & enforcement.
	Accountability & transparency.
	Audit preparedness & process compliance.
	Effective communication & cross-department collaboration


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 19th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (PDF format) to: [email protected] using "Accountant" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Business Development Manager to lead growth initiatives you will be responsible for driving the company’s growth agenda by identifying new market opportunities, building strategic partnerships, and expanding client relationships.
	This role requires a commercially minded leader with strong business acumen who understand the consulting sector and execution with high-level growth strategy.
	As BDM, you will identify opportunities, foster relationships with high-value clients, and drive revenue growth for our HR and compliance services.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement strategies to acquire new clients and retain existing ones.
	Manage, mentor, and motivate the business development team to achieve and exceed set targets.
	Conduct market research and competitive analysis to guide growth strategy, positioning, and marketing initiatives.
	Partner with team members to develop tailored proposals, pitches, and campaigns.
	Drive end-to-end client engagement from prospecting through negotiation, deal closure, onboarding, and long-term relationship management.
	Track, analyze, and report on business development performance, conversion rates, and market insights to inform decision-making.
	Represent the company at key industry events, networking forums, and business meetings to strengthen visibility and positioning.
	Support senior leadership in identifying new markets, products, and service opportunities to diversify revenue streams.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.
	3-5 years of progressive experience in business development, sales, marketing or growth strategy.
	Proven success in driving revenue growth and building long-term partnerships.
	Strong leadership, interpersonal, and negotiation skills.
	Track record of exceeding business development or sales targets.
	Experience in consulting, branding, or marketing industry is highly desirable.
	Ability to balance strategic thinking with deal execution.


Salary
N250,000 Net per month + (Commission).

Application Closing Date: 16th February, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
